isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - INSTALL - ENGINE COVER and cup holder

svcsubproc.title: Install One Piece Engine Cover on Standard Cab and Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400 and 7500 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 126 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position engine cover (Item 2) inside cab. Slide engine cover in place under the dash panel.
Pull floor mat back away from bottom edge of the engine cover (Item 2) to allow engine cover mounting hole flanges to rest on the cab floor.
Pull passenger side floor mat back away from bottom edge of the engine cover (Item 2). Install hex flanged bolts (Item 5) through engine cover into cab floor. DO NOT tighten.
Pull floor mat back away from bottom edge across the front of the engine cover (Item 2). Install three hex flanged bolt (Item 4) through engine cover into cab floor. DO NOT tighten.
Pull driver side floor mat back away from bottom edge of the engine cover (Item 2). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 3) through engine cover into cab floor. DO NOT tighten.
Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 1) at the top of the engine cover (Item 2) through engine cover into dash panel. DO NOT tighten.
Once all hex flanged bolts (Items 1, 3, 4 and 5) have been installed, tighten them to 77 to 95 Lbf-in (8.7 to 10.7 N•m).
Once all hex flanged bolts (Items 1, 3, 4 and 5) have been tightened, position floor mat properly around the bottom of the engine cover.

Install passenger bucket seat, fixed passenger seat, fixed passenger bench seat without tool box or fixed passenger bench seat with tool box, refer to
SEATS
. For installing passenger bucket seat, refer to Install Passenger Bucket Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing fixed passenger seat, refer to Install Fixed Passenger Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing two man fixed bench seat without tool box, refer to Install Two Man Fixed Bench Seat without Tool Box on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing two man fixed bench seat with tool box, refer to Install Two Man Fixed Bench Seat with Tool Box on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

svcsubproc.title: Install Two Piece Engine Cover on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for 7600 Model, Standard Cab for 7700 Model and Standard Cab and Extended Cab for 8600 Model
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 127 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position rear engine cover (Item 5) inside cab. Slide rear engine cover in place under the dash panel.
Pull floor mat back away from bottom edge of the rear engine cover (Item 5) to allow rear engine cover mounting hole flanges to rest on the cab floor.
Pull passenger side floor mat back away from bottom edge of the rear engine cover (Item 5). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 7) through rear engine cover into cab floor. DO NOT tighten.
Pull driver side floor mat back away from bottom edge of the rear engine cover (Item 5). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 6) through rear engine cover into cab floor. DO NOT tighten.
Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 4) at the top of the rear engine cover (Item 5) through rear engine cover into dash panel. DO NOT tighten.
Once hex flanged bolts (Items 4, 6 and 7) have been installed, tighten them to 77 to 95 Lbf-in (8.7 to 10.7 N•m).
Position front engine cover (Item 1) inside cab. Slide front engine cover in place under the dash panel and up against the rear engine cover (Item 5).
Pull passenger side floor mat back away from bottom edge of the front engine cover (Item 1). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 3) through front engine cover into cab floor. DO NOT tighten.
Pull driver side floor mat back away from bottom edge of the front engine cover (Item 1). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 2) through front engine cover into cab floor. DO NOT tighten.
Once hex flanged bolts (Items 2 and 3) have been installed, tighten them to 77 to 95 Lbf-in (8.7 to 10.7 N•m).
Once all hex flanged bolts (Items 2, 3, 4, 6 and 7) have been tightened, position floor mat properly around the bottom of the front and rear engine covers.
If so equipped, install rubberized cover over the engine cover.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cup Holder and Ashtray on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 125 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If so equipped, install cup holder and ashtray (Item 4) as follows.

Position cup holder and ashtray (Item 4) underneath center dash panel (Item 1), slide cup holder and ashtray forward to hook the back of the cup holder and ashtray to the underside of the center dash panel. Install two torx head screws (Item 3) through the front center dash panel into the cup holder and ashtray. Tighten them to 20 to 25 Lbf-in (2.3 to 3.0 N•m).
Position the center dash panel trim bezel (Item 2) in place over the center dash panel (Item 1). Carefully push it into center dash panel until it snaps into place.
